content:
As of fall 2020, I am a PhD student in the Robotics Institute at Carnegie Mellon University. I am grateful to be funded by the NSF Graduate Research Fellowship.
Previously, I was a data scientist at the Global AI Accelerator (GAIA) within Ericsson. I worked on applying machine learning to problems within telecommunications, such as using causal inference and deep reinforcement learning to optimize the performance of radio networks.
During my undergrad, I had the privilege of doing research in multiple robotics labs at Berkeley: Human-Assistive Robotic Technologies Lab under Prof. Ruzena Bajcsy, Biomimetic Millisystems Lab under Prof. Ron Fearing, and the InterACT Lab under Prof. Anca Dragan.
summary:

title: Ravi Pandya
Nonverbal Robot Feedback for Human Teachers
Nonverbal Robot Feedback for Human Teachers

summary: Designed circuits and PCBs for motor drivers, encoders, and a line camera; wrote sensing and controls code to autonomously navigate a complicated track.
title: Line-Following Car

summary: Analyzed the robustness of nonlinear controllers (Feedback Linearizing, Adaptive, Computed Torque, Sliding Mode) under disturbances and model misspecification for a 2DOF Matlab simulated robot arm and a 7DOF Kinova Jaco in a C++ ROS framework utilizing Gazebo.
title: Robustness Analysis of Nonlinear Controllers
Human-AI Learning Performance in Multi-Armed Bandits
Learning Image-Conditioned Dynamics Models for Under-actuated Legged Millirobots
Learning Human Ergonomic Preferences for Handovers

summary: Wrote software for sensing, planning and control of Baxter Robot to allow it to intelligently play a gameof checkers against a human.
title: Checkers-Playing Robot

content:
[does listening to an audiobook count as reading? I say yes]
Books I’m currently reading  Born a Crime - Trevor Noah Dune - Frank Herbert The Eight - Katherine Neville  Books/Series I’ve read recently  A Beautifully Foolish Endeavor - Hank Green Mistborn (The Final Empire, The Well of Ascension, The Hero of Ages) - Brandon Sanderson The Kingkiller Chronicles (The Name of the Wind & The Wise Man’s Fear) - Patrick Rothfuss The Rook Files (The Rook & Stiletto) - Daniel O’Malley Sphere - Michael Crichton
